title: VMware Cloud Foundation as a Service docs
introduction: IBM Cloud for VMware Cloud Foundation as a Service is an IBM Cloud offering that deploys a comprehensive portfolio of automated and on-demand services for VMware by Broadcom workloads to the cloud. Learn how to make the most of your VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF) as a Service experience by using the docs.

section_recommended.title: Getting started with VCF as a Service
section_recommended.description: Get familiar with the process of ordering a VCF as a Service instance.

section_recommended.title: Planning the deployment
section_recommended.description: Ensure that you plan your deployment properly.

section_recommended.title: Ordering instances
section_recommended.description: You can order a VCF as a Service instance.

section_recommended.title: Adding hosts
section_recommended.description: You can increase or decrease the capacity of your deployment.

section_recommended.title: Adding virtual data centers
section_recommended.description: You can deploy one or more virtual data centers.

section_recommended.title: Viewing instances
section_recommended.description: You can view the information of the instances that are provisioned for your account.

tiles.title: IBM Cloud data center support for Toronto multitenant
tiles.description: VCF as a Service expands global presence and now supports the Toronto region to host your multitenant VMware workloads.

tiles.title: Disaster recovery with VMware Cloud Director Availability
tiles.description: You can now use VMware Cloud Director Availability (VCDA) to configure a disaster recovery plan for your primary workload environment.

tiles.title: IBM Cloud data center support for Toronto single-tenant
tiles.description: VCF as a Service expands global presence and now supports the Toronto region to host your single-tenant VMware workloads.
